title: Static download for INOVICS corporate presentation deck (Option 1 theme)

requirements.summary: Add a 14-slide INOVICS corporate presentation PowerPoint (.pptx) asset matching the provided slide-by-slide content and Option 1 styling.
acceptanceCriteria: A .pptx file is produced that contains 14 slides matching the provided titles and body text (Slide 1 through Slide 14).
The deck uses a dark navy background and yellow accent consistent with the site’s palette (navy/charcoal + accent yellow), with a clean enterprise layout.
Slides avoid stock handshake imagery, avoid heavy icon usage, and use abstract/data/grid-style visuals where visuals are needed.
Typography hierarchy is consistent across slides (large bold headings, readable body text, spacing aligned to a coherent grid).

file_operations.description: Create the downloadable PowerPoint deck as a static asset. The file must include 14 slides using the exact slide-by-slide titles/body text provided in the conversation, and apply Option 1 styling (dark navy background, accent yellow, clean enterprise grid, abstract/data/grid visuals; avoid stock/cheesy imagery and heavy icons).

requirements.summary: Expose the corporate deck as a static download and add a clear UI entry point to download it.
acceptanceCriteria: The .pptx is available as a static file in the frontend (served without requiring backend calls).
A user can click a “Download Corporate Deck (PPTX)” (or equivalent English label) in the UI and the browser downloads the .pptx successfully.
The download link works in production build (not only in dev).

file_operations.description: Add an exported constant for the static PPTX URL (pointing to frontend/public/assets/inovics-corporate-deck-option-1.pptx) so UI components can link to the deck consistently.

Add a clearly labeled download entry point (e.g., a new card/action) that links directly to the static PPTX and triggers a browser download. Use existing shadcn-ui Card/Button styling for consistency with the site theme; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
